content: When we run the publisher and there's a slicing issue, we get a handy-dandy 'Slicing Information' entry to help figure out what's going on. Is there a way to spit out that same information when launching the validator in stand-alone?
not at the moment. do you want to create a github issue about that?

https://github.com/hapifhir/org.hl7.fhir.validator/issues/1
(though given that it's issue#1, I'm wondering if I posted in the right place?)
I don't know what that other repository is.
@James Agnew - should that other repository go away? (May be confusing to other folks than just me :) )
That repo is a new UI for the validator that @Mark Iantorno is working on. It's brand new so it doesn't yet have a readme, but it probably should...
I will be making a big push to that repo on Monday or Tuesday that will include a readme
oh that's what it is. It should be called something slightly different then ([x]-ui), and the readme should direct people to the validator core for issues
At the top I'll put a message like "please ignore me"
Please stick to the repos you have been already using.
I hadn't been using any (that I could remember :)) - thus the confusion
